TopicTitle: Where the name Minmus came from?

Articles.Content:
Is there something your not telling us Squad?

http://blog.pixable.com/2013/05/28/12-things-i-bet-you-didnt-know-the-actual-name-of/

Read number 1.
Wow. Now I can say that Minmus is on my foot!
Well because Minmus is small
Heh, I can reach Minmus from home!

Heh, I can reach Minmus from home!

With your nose?

Is there something your not telling us Squad?

http://blog.pixable.com/2013/05/28/12-things-i-bet-you-didnt-know-the-actual-name-of/

Read number 1.

I have problem finding sources confirming that.

Your fifth toe's latin name is digitus minimus. Not minmus.

I thought it came from the Latin minimus, the smallest member of a group.

This is much better though

EDIT: damn ninjas!
Now lets find out were the other names came from

MohoroviÃ„ÂiÃ„â€¡ Discontinuity aka the Moho.

PS if your little toe is turquoise HarvesteR you should probably change shower gels.

Edited October 25, 2013 by boolybooly

Well i found out that duna is a car http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiat_Duna.

But id doubt thats were the name came from
Doesn't taste like pudding.....

I thought it came from the Latin minimus, the smallest member of a group.

And so does the name of the toe, the digitus minimus; I think that site is just a typo.

Also, number 10, the interrobang - ?!, is an awesome name.

Number ten is also wrong -- the interrobang is specifically a single punctuation mark that combines the "!" and "?" into one symbol, not just any appearance of "!?".

That said, an interesting article.
I think it's a mispelled Minimus.

I think it has something to do with those two guys:

Source

The other planets' name origins are this:

Eve - Probably a word derived from the name Venus

Gilly - No idea.

Kerbin - Named after the Kerbals. "Kerbal" was a random name HarvesteR gave to little tin foil dudes on bottle rockets and the name stuck.

Mun - "Moon," but with a 'u'

Duna - Most likely a reference to the planet "Arrakis" in the Dune novels. Was called "Egar" at one point.

Ike - No idea.

Jool - Probably derived from the name "Jupiter," also conveniently fits in with the phrase "Jool-y Green Giant." Was called "Meander" at one point.

Don't even ask me what the name for Jool's moons are. Except for one.

Pol - looks like a pollen grain.

Eeloo - play on the word "igloo"

I don't see a toe called "Minmus" here, just a Digitus minimus pedis

"The name 'Minmus' may be derived from the Latin word 'minimus', which denotes the smallest member of a group of beings or creatures" (not necessarily toes)

We had identical threads before. Honestly, do kids know how to use search engines?

The fifth toe is not minmus, it's digitus minimus pedis, meaning the smallest toe on the foot.

Just my two cents, I have no idea where the names actually came from.

In star wars, the planet where the Hutts live is called Nal Hutta, Meaning "glorious jewel" maybe Jool came from that?

Minmus might have come from on of Saturn's moons: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mimas_%28moon%29

But who really knows Oh wait, Ill be Squad does!!! lol
Origin of KSP planetary bodies names
